org.latency4j.alert

Class AbstractAlertHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.alert.AbstractAlertHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AlertHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MissedTargetAlertLogger, MissedTargetAlertMailer

    public abstract class AbstractAlertHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements AlertHandler

    Abstract class which provides basic plumbing for alert handler implementations. Developers wishing to implement their own handlers are advised to simply extend this class as it already provides most of the functionality mandated by the handler interface.

    Instances of this handler require the following parameters:

    • StandardHandlerConstants.CAP_EXCEEDED_MSG_PARAM_KEY: The template for messages issued to indicate that a duration has breached its corresponding latency requirement. Where this parameter is not specified, the default StandardHandlerConstants.DEFAULT_MESSAGE_FOR_MISSED_TARGET is used. See prepareLatencyExceededCap(CappedLatencyRequirement, WorkDuration)
    • StandardHandlerConstants.WORK_CATEGORY_FAILED_MSG_PARAM_KEY: The template for messages issued to indicate that a monitored task has failed with an error. Where this parameter is not specified, the default StandardHandlerConstants.DEFAULT_MESSAGE_FOR_WORK_FAILURE is used. See prepareWorkCategoryFailedMsg(LatencyRequirement, WorkDuration)
    • StandardHandlerConstants.EXCEEDED_TOLERANCE_MSG_PARAM_KEY: The template for messages issued to indicate that the duration of a monitored task does not fall within the specified tolerance when compared to the long running average. Where this parameter is not specified, the default StandardHandlerConstants.DEFAULT_TOLERANCE_EXCEEDED_MESSAGE is used. See prepareDeviationExceededToleranceMsg(StatisticalLatencyRequirement, WorkDuration, double, double).

      • getParameters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getParameters()

        Returns a reference to the parameter/argument map with which the instance is initialised. It essentially returns the same value as was passed by the most recent call to setParameters(Map), or null if there has not been any such invocation.

        Returns:
        The parameters with which this listener instance is initialised.

      • assertInitialized

        protected void assertInitialized()

        Internal assertion which raises an error if the handler instance has not been initialised. It is recommended that subclasses of this handler perform this assertion prior to servicing alerts.

      • prepareDeviationExceededToleranceMsg

        protected java.lang.String prepareDeviationExceededToleranceMsg(StatisticalLatencyRequirement requirement,
                                                                WorkDuration duration,
                                                                double deviationFromMean,
                                                                double mean)

        Internal method which is used to format notification messages where a task latency has exceeded the mean by more than the pre-specified tolerance.

        The message template is given by the value of the configuration parameter StandardHandlerConstants.EXCEEDED_TOLERANCE_MSG_PARAM_KEY.

        The message template can also include filters that can be used to infuse the completed message with details of the task, duration, etc. For more details, see the delegate method see AlertFormatter.formatLatencyExceededToleranceMessage(StatisticalLatencyRequirement, WorkDuration, double, double, String)

        Parameters:
        requirement - The requirement to which the alert message relates.
        duration - The duration of the task which triggered the alert for which the message is being formatted.
        deviationFromMean - The deviation of the task from the observed average duration.
        mean - The observed average duration to date.
        Returns:
        A formatted notification message with all filters specified in the template replaced with actual values from the parameters.
        See Also:
        AlertHandler.latencyExceededCap(CappedLatencyRequirement, WorkDuration)

      • prepareLatencyExceededCap

        protected java.lang.String prepareLatencyExceededCap(CappedLatencyRequirement requirement,
                                                     WorkDuration duration)

        Helper method which is used to format notification messages where a duration has exceeded a fixed latency cap. The message template is given by the value of the initialisation parameter StandardHandlerConstants.CAP_EXCEEDED_MSG_PARAM_KEY.

        The message template can include filters, which can be used to infuse the completed message with details of the task, duration, etc. For more details, see the delegate method see AlertFormatter.formatTargetMissedMessage(CappedLatencyRequirement, WorkDuration, String)

        Parameters:
        requirement - The requirement to which the notification relates.
        duration - The duration of the operation which triggered the alert.
        Returns:
        A formatted alert message with all filters specified in the template replaced with actual values from the parameters.

      • prepareWorkCategoryFailedMsg

        protected java.lang.String prepareWorkCategoryFailedMsg(LatencyRequirement requirement,
                                                        WorkDuration duration)

        Utility method which formats a notification message indicating that a monitored task has failed with an exception. The message template is given by the value of the parameter StandardHandlerConstants.WORK_CATEGORY_FAILED_MSG_PARAM_KEY.

        The message template can also include filters that can be used to infuse the completed message with details of the task, duration, exception etc. For more details, see the delegate method AlertFormatter.formatWorkCategoryFailureMessage(LatencyRequirement, WorkDuration, String)

        Parameters:
        requirement - The requirement covering the failed operation.
        duration - The duration of the failed operation.
        Returns:
        A formatted alert message with all filters specified in the template replaced with actual values from the given requirement and duration.
